Class Frog

  • java.lang.Object
    • Frog

  • public class Frog
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles display, movement, and fly eating capabalities for frogs

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage image 
      protected static java.lang.String imgFile 
      protected GridLocation location 
      protected FlyWorld world 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Frog(GridLocation loc, FlyWorld fw)
      Creates a new Frog object.
      The image file for a frog is frog.jpg

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      This method helps determine if a frog is in a location
      where it can eat a fly or not.
      GridLocation[] generateLegalMoves()
      Generates a list of ALL possible legal moves
      for a frog.
      You should select all possible grid locations from
      the world based on the following restrictions
      Frogs can move one space in any of the four cardinal directions but
      1.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage() 
      GridLocation getLocation() 
      boolean isPredator() 
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Frog showing the location coordinates and the world.
      void update()
      This method updates the frog's position.
      It should randomly select one of the legal locations(if there any)
      and set the frog's location to the chosen updated location.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation

      • generateLegalMoves

        public GridLocation[] generateLegalMoves()
        Generates a list of ALL possible legal moves
        for a frog.
        You should select all possible grid locations from
        the world based on the following restrictions
        Frogs can move one space in any of the four cardinal directions but
        1. Can not move off the grid
        2. Can not move onto a square that already has frog on it
        GridLocation has a method to help you determine if there is a frog
        on a location or not.
        Returns:
        GridLocation[] a collection of legal grid locations from
        the world that the frog can move to

      • update

        public void update()
        This method updates the frog's position.
        It should randomly select one of the legal locations(if there any)
        and set the frog's location to the chosen updated location.

      • eatsFly

        public boolean eatsFly()
        This method helps determine if a frog is in a location
        where it can eat a fly or not. A frog can eat the fly if it
        is on the same square as the fly or 1 spaces away in
        one of the cardinal directions
        Returns:
        boolean true if the fly can be eaten, false otherwise
